intro: Masdevallia ephippium, commonly known as the "Pineapple Orchid," is a terrestrial orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, clustered growth habit and its striking, often colorful flowers that resemble a pineapple. The plant typically features long, narrow leaves and produces fragrant, showy blooms in shades of yellow, orange, and red. It thrives in cool, humid environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Masdevallia ephippium is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
